title: The Hat Incident
story: Helen is unhappy with her mother. Her mother is unhappy with Helen. They are both unhappy with each other. Helen has a boyfriend. His name is Peter. Her mother doesn't like Peter. Her mother said that Peter is rude. Why did she say that? Because Peter didn't take his hat off in the house. Helen's mother says that is rude. A man should take his hat off in the house. "Your father always took his hat off in the house," Helen's mother said. "But, Mom, times are different now," Helen said. "I promise you, Peter will take his hat off next time." Helen's mother said it was too late—rude is rude.
summary: In this family drama, tensions arise when Helen's boyfriend, Peter, doesn't take his hat off in the house. Helen's mother believes it is rude and refuses to accept any excuses.
image: An image of Helen, her mother, and Peter having a heated discussion about the hat incident.
